alert.note: Alert for Washington (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:29AM EST until January 12 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Rhode Island... Blackstone River At Northbridge affecting Worcester County. Blackstone River At Woonsocket affecting Providence and Worcester Counties. Wood River At Hope Valley affecting Washington County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Rhode Island...Connecticut... Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Kent and Providence Counties. Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting Washington and New London Counties. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Blackstone River...including Northbridge, Woonsocket... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Major flooding is forecast. For the Pawcatuck River...including Wood River Junction, Westerly... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wood River...including Hope Valley...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wood River at Hope Valley. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, In Richmond, the Wood River blocks sections of Tall Timbers Drive, Leroy Drive, Wood River Circle and Wood River Drive. Dow field off of main Street in Hopkinton is substantially flooded. Also, floodwaters begin to reach the bottom edge of the Skunk Hill Road Bridge on the Richmond and Hopkinton Town Line. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM EST Wednesday was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.0 feet on 10/15/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM EST.
